main event: Unidentified flying objects were reportedly seen in western Montana in the middle of April, described as being as big as an airplane, brightly lit, and flying swiftly without any sound, appearing to hover and then dart off at high speed, frightening the witnesses.
interesting points: The report originated from an unknown source and there is no evidence to confirm its validity.
The individual who submitted the report claimed to have had sightings since the original incident, but is now over 80 years old and has difficulty recalling specific details.
The report mentions that the sightings were reported to the Air Force at the time, but no further information is provided.
The report includes a handwritten note indicating that the sightings were believed by the Military Intelligence Division in Washington, D.C.
The report mentions that photographs were sent for analysis, but they were not received by the investigators.
sighted object: Unidentified flying objects described as being as big as an airplane, brightly lit, and flying swiftly without any sound
witnesses: multiple unnamed persons in the area
photographs: yes, but not received by investigators
